list.description: The Minimum Data Set (MDS) scrubber interface allows MDS coordinators to send in-progress and completed  MDS assessments  electronically to a 3rd-party MDS scrubbing vendor and receive real-time feedback.

list.heading: EPS Document Retrieval Web Service
list.description: This web service integration enables Epic print services (EPS) to query a document management system (DMS) for images or documents to insert into a print job. This is useful when you want a scan to be stored in your DMS, but want to include that scan in something you print.

list.heading: Wait Time APIs
list.description: This set of APIs returns estimated wait time information. Select the appropriate API to retrieve wait time information for a given emergency department, urgent care clinic, ambulatory clinic, or outpatient provider.

list.heading: Print Test Page
list.description: Use the PrintTestPage API to trigger test print jobs from a specified printer device.

list.heading: Output Management Web Service
list.description: Epic integrates with third-party output management systems using the outbound print job web services. These web services allow Epic community members to send print requests to a third-party output management server and receive back information about whether the print job was successful.

list.heading: Print Job Status
list.description: Use the UpdatePrintJobStatus API to send back information about the status of the print job received from Epic through the Epic Print Service (EPS).

list.heading: Encryption Guide
list.description: PACS integrations use encryption to protect confidential information sent between systems. This guide describes the technical details of Epic’s supported encryption algorithms, including step-by-step instructions and sample encrypted payloads.

interfaceDescription: Standards developed by Digital Imaging and Communications  are used internationally for communicating medical images and related information. You can learn more from   DICOM .

list.heading: Imaging Integration
list.description: Epic has APIs available for PACS integration that include single sign-on, patient context synchronization, study context synchronization, and real-time measurement exchange. These APIs have been implemented to varying degrees across PACS and CPACS vendors. Check out our  DICOM conformance statement  as well. We additionally have an  encryption utility  for use with our XML integration (identical to URL encryption).

list.heading: MWL (Modality Work List)
list.description: This DICOM interface enables a piece of imaging equipment to obtain details of patients and scheduled examinations electronically, avoiding the need to type such information multiple times.

list.heading: MPPS (Modality Performed Procedure Step)
list.description: This DICOM interface provides a mechanism for modalities to send the procedure start and procedure complete notification.

list.heading: SR (Structured Reporting)
list.description: This DICOM interface provides a mechanism for modalities to send structured information from the performed exam to Epic. Each modality or exam can send different measurements.

list.heading: SC (Secondary Capture)
list.description: This DICOM interface provides a mechanism for modalities or a PACS to forward a copy of the DICOM SC images flagged by the technologist to Epic. We can process this message and file the image to be used when reviewing the patient's chart.

list.heading: WADO (Web Access to DICOM Objects) Import of Key Objects
list.description: This DICOM interface pulls key objects from the PACS via WADO to support streamlined workflows throughout the EHR.

interfaceDescription: The National Council for Prescription Drug Programs develops standards related to the real-time exchange of information about pharmacy services. You can learn more from  NCPDP .

list.heading: Outgoing Medication History for Populations Request and Response
list.description: Performs queries to get the medication dispense history for registries of patients to assist in tracking patients' medication adherence.

list.heading: Incoming External Paid Pharmacy Claims Interface
list.description: Loads external paid pharmacy claims messages into Epic Payer Platform or Tapestry, Epic's managed care application, using flag files in the NCPDP Post-Adjudication format.

list.heading: Outgoing Prescription Prior Authorization Request and Reponse
list.description: Supports message events necessary for a prescribing provider to request an electronic prior authorization for a medication order and receive either approval or denial from a Pharmacy Benefits Manager, and supports messages to cancel requests. These interfaces for electronic prior authorization support a subset of the NCPDP 2013101 standard.

list.heading: Outgoing Medication Orders to Retail Pharmacies
list.description: Used for e-prescribing when the organization is the prescriber.  Uses NCPDP SCRIPT 10.6 or 2017071 to send new prescriptions, renewal responses, cancel requests, and change responses with an external pharmacy.

list.heading: Incoming Refill Requests from Retail Pharmacies
list.description: Uses NCPDP SCRIPT 10.6 or 2017071 to receive renewal requests, cancel responses, and change requests from external pharmacies.

list.heading: Outgoing Medication Dispense History Query
list.description: E-prescribing functionality when Epic is the prescriber. Uses NCPDP SCRIPT 10.6 or 2017071 to receive medication history information from external sources.

list.heading: Incoming Medication Orders to Willow Ambulatory
list.description: Uses NCPDP SCRIPT 10.6 or 2017071 to receive new prescriptions, renewal responses, and cancel requests from external providers into Epic's ambulatory pharmacy product.

list.heading: Outgoing Refill Requests from Willow Ambulatory
list.description: E-prescribing functionality when Epic is the Pharmacy.  Uses NCPDP SCRIPT 10.6 or 2017071 to send renewal requests and cancel responses to external providers from Willow Ambulatory.

list.heading: Outgoing Pharmacy Update from Willow Ambulatory to E-Prescribing System Interface
list.description: Sends messages to an e-prescribing system to change e-prescribing related settings of an ambulatory pharmacy, such as service levels or operating mode.

list.heading: Outgoing Provider Download to E-Prescribing System Interface
list.description: Queries an external e-prescribing system for current and updated e-prescribing provider data.

list.heading: Outgoing Organization Download to E-Prescribing System
list.description: Queries an external e-prescribing system for current and updated e-prescribing pharmacy data.

list.heading: Outgoing Provider Update to E-Prescribing System Interface
list.description: Sends messages to an e-prescribing system when changes to e-prescribing related settings are made to provider's record, such as service levels or contact information.

list.heading: Outgoing Formulary Query to e-Prescribing System
list.description: Downloads NCPDP Formulary & Benefit files from an external source to provide formulary information to the provider during order entry.

list.heading: Outgoing Pharmacy Benefit Claims Adjudication Query
list.description: This real-time interface is used to determine what portion of a prescription's cost will be paid by the patient's insurance so that the patient can be charged appropriately for the prescription fill. Claim Adjudication uses NCPDP Telecommunication version D.0.

interfaceDescription: ASC X12 standards are used for facilitating electronic interchange relating to business processes, in both healthcare and other industries. You can learn more from  ASC X12 .

list.heading: Outgoing Referral Inquiry - 278I
list.description: Sends inquiries to clearinghouses and payers about existing authorization information for a patient and receives responses to those inquiries. Inquiries can originate from the referring organization, or from the referred to organization. This interface is often used in conjunction with the Outgoing Health Care Services Authorization Request - 278/278 interface.

list.heading: Tapestry Incoming Health Care Claim: Repricing Request - 837
list.description: Tapestry receives incoming claim repricing requests through ANSI ASC X12 837 transactions.

list.heading: Incoming External Paid Medical Claims Interface - 837
list.description: Loads external paid medical claims messages into Epic Payer Platform, using flat files in the 837 format.

list.heading: Incoming Pharmacy Price Sales Catalog to Willow Inventory Interface
list.description: Updates purchase contract records with up-to-date pricing and supplier item ID information.

list.heading: Outgoing Additional Information to Support a Health Care Services Authorization Query
list.description: Used in conjunction with an Outgoing Referral Request for Review - 278R, provides supporting clinical documentation for the request. Follows ANSI X12 specification  005010X211, ANSI X12 275 for Authorization, Additional Information to Support a Health Care Services Review (275)

list.heading: Incoming Claim File Acknowledgment Interface – 999
list.description: This incoming interface loads claim file acknowledgment responses using industry standard ANSI ASC X12N 999 transactions.

list.heading: Outgoing Authorization Request as Notification - 278R
list.description: Sends authorization decisions for covered patient referrals to third-party AP claims systems using the 278R format rather than 278N. Required by Texas Medicaid.

list.heading: Tapestry Incoming Marketplace Benefit Enrollment and Maintenance
list.description: Receives eligibility information to create, term, and update Marketplace coverage information.

list.heading: Tapestry Incoming Marketplace Premium Payment Information
list.description: Receives and processes premium payments associated with Marketplace coverages in Epic

list.heading: Tapestry Outgoing Marketplace Benefit Enrollment and Maintenance
list.description: Sends marketplace coverage enrollment information government agencies or other entities.

list.heading: Tapestry Incoming Additional Information for Health Care Claim - 275
list.description: Receives electronic attachments and links them to Tapestry claims.

list.heading: Incoming Additional Information to Support a Health Care Services Review - 275
list.description: Used in conjunction with an Incoming Referral Request for Review - 278R, provides supporting documents for the referral request.  Follows ANSI X12 Specification 005010X211, ANSI X12 275 for Authorization, Additional Information to Support a Health Care Services Review.

list.heading: Outgoing Additional Informaiton for Health Care Claim - 275
list.description: Sends additional information to support a Healthcare Claim from Epic's billing module, Resolute

list.heading: Outgoing Pharmacy Purchase Order from Willow Inventory
list.description: Sends medication purchase order requests to a supplier. The interface uses the ANSI X12 850 transaction set or GS1 for the request.

list.heading: Incoming Pharmacy Purchase Order Invoice to Willow Inventory
list.description: Receives invoices from a supplier for purchase orders placed in Willow Inventory, Epic's medication inventory management system. The interface uses the ANSI X12 810 transaction set for the response.

list.heading: Outgoing Health Care Claims
list.description: Sends professional claim information to payers. The 837 transmits claim information either for the purpose of payment, such as a provider sending a bill to a payer, or for the purpose of reporting, such as a delegated risk payer sending payment information to a health plan or the government.

list.heading: Health Care Claims - Incoming 837
list.description: Tapestry receives incoming professional, institutional, or dental claims through ANSI ASC X12 837 transactions.

list.heading: Outgoing Health Care Claim Remittance Advice - 835
list.description: Sends claim payment and remittance information to health care providers. The 835 lets providers know which claims are paid and whether there is any difference between the payment amount and the billed amount. This is a batch interface.

list.heading: Incoming Benefit Enrollment and Maintenance -  834
list.description: Receives enrollment information from employers or other sponsors of coverage. Health plans and employers send 834s to inform a payer about members who are being enrolled in the payer's insurance plan or for whom the payer is otherwise taking on risk.

list.heading: Incoming Health Care Claim Status - 276/277
list.description: Receives requests from health care providers for status information about claims, including whether the claim was paid or unpaid and why. Tapestry supports the batch interface by default, with a real-time interface available.

list.heading: Incoming Payment Order/Remittance Advice - 820
list.description: Receives payment and remittance information. Tapestry supports an incoming 820 for the purpose of posting payment information against premium billing accounts.

list.heading: Tapestry Outgoing Benefit Enrollment and Maintenance - 834
list.description: Sends enrollment information to health plans, government agencies, or other entities. Payers send 834s for reporting purposes to list all members for whom they have taken on risk.

list.heading: Incoming Eligibility, Coverage, or Benefit Inquiry -  270/271
list.description: Receives requests from health care providers for member eligibility and benefits information in the form of a 270, and sends a response in the form of a 271. This is a real-time interface.

list.heading: Incoming Referral Request for Review - 278R
list.description: Receives a referral request from a provider or provider group so that Epic's managed care system can perform utilization management and approve or deny the service request.  A response message is sent to inform the provider of the authorization decision.

list.heading: Outgoing Health Care Claim Pending Status Notification - 277P
list.description: Sends information to a health care provider about the status of all non-finalized claims received from that provider. The 277P is an unsolicited message that is similar to the 277 response to the 276. It is sent so that the provider doesn't have to continually send 276 requests to the payer.

list.heading: Incoming Authorization Notification - 278N
list.description: Receives unsolicited, completed referral information (usually with authorization numbers) from an external utilization management system so that Epic' Managed Care system can pay Accounts Payable (AP) claims. Sends an acknowledgment of the receipt of the information (or errors if any occur during message processing).

list.heading: Outgoing Eligibility Verification Query
list.description: Used to verify eligibility with clearinghouses and payers. Uses ANSI X12 270/271 transactions.

list.heading: Outgoing Claims Status Request 276/277
list.description: Sends requests and receives responses from payers and intermediary systems about claim statuses using industry standard ANSI ASC X12N 276/277 transactions. Epic uses web services to send and receive the X12 messages.

list.heading: Outgoing Authorization Request for Review and Response - 278R
list.description: Transmits patient referral or authorization information to a third-party system. The referral/authorization information is sent in order to obtain authorization for health care services (such as specialty referrals and procedures) with clearing houses and payers. It uses ANSI X12 278 transactions.

list.heading: Outgoing Pharmacy Benefit Eligibility Query - 270/271
list.description: E-Prescribing functionality when Epic is the Prescriber. Initiates pharmacy benefit eligibility queries.

list.heading: Outgoing Admission Notification
list.description: Used to notify a payer or health plan about an admission for one of their covered a patients. The ANSI X12 278 transaction is used for both the original notification of the admission and the payer response that might follow. Such a response might contain the reference/authorization number to be sent later on the claim.

list.heading: Outgoing Authorization Notification - 278N
list.description: Sends authorization decisions for covered patient referrals to third-party AP claims systems. The response from the third-party AP claims system is the acknowledgement of the information received.

list.heading: Incoming Purchase Order Acknowledgement to Willow Inventory
list.description: Receives acknowledgements from a supplier for purchase orders placed in Willow Inventory. The interface uses the ANSI X12 855 transaction set for the response.

list.heading: Incoming Shipment Notification to Willow Inventory
list.description: Receives information about items sent by a supplier to fill a purchase order from Willow Inventory medication inventory management. This interface uses the ANSI X12 856 transaction set or European GS1.

list.heading: Outgoing Health Care Claims for Institutional, Professional, and Dental Services
list.description: This outgoing batch interface sends insurance claim information to payers and intermediary systems using industry standard ANSI ASC X12N 837 transactions (institutional, professional and dental).

list.heading: Outgoing Health Care Data Reporting Claims
list.description: This outgoing batch interface sends insurance claim information to government and intermediary systems using the industry standard ANSI ASC X12N 837 data reporting transaction.

list.heading: Incoming Claim Status Batch (X12 277) - Rapid Retest
list.description: This interface builds upon the use of standard Claim Reconciliation sends individual claims to intermediary systems using industry standard  ANSI ASC X12N 837 transactions (institutional, professional, and dental)  and loads information about claim status back using industry standard  ANSI ASC X12N 277 or 277CA transactions . This interface updates the status of errored claims in the system.

list.heading: Incoming Health Care Claim Payment/Advice
list.description: This incoming batch interface posts insurance claim payment information received directly from payers and content aggregators, such as claims clearinghouses and banks, using standard ANSI ASC X12N 835 transactions.

list.heading: Outgoing Health Care Claim Acknowledgement
list.description: This outgoing batch interface sends claim acknowledgement responses to incoming ANSI 837 files using ANSI ASC X12N 277CA transactions.

list.heading: Outgoing Health Care Services Functional Acknowledgement
list.description: This message is sent in response to incoming healthcare services messages. It acknowledges the receipt of the message and, if necessary, reports any formatting errors in the file. It is an ANSI ASC X12N 999 transaction.

list.heading: Tapestry Outgoing Front-End Claim Status Acknowledgment (X12 277CA)
list.description: Tapestry Outgoing Front-End Claim Status Acknowledgment (X12 277CA).

list.heading: Incoming Marketplace Benefit Enrollment and Maintenance  (HIX 834)
list.description: Standard X12 format for loading marketplace information.

list.heading: Incoming X12 HIX 820
list.description: Incoming Standard X12 format for loading Marketplace Premium Payment Information.

list.heading: Outgoing Marketplace Benefit Enrollment and Maintenance  (HIX 834)
list.description: Standard X12 format for sending out marketplace coverage information

list.heading: Outgoing Referral Inquiry (X12 278I)
list.description: Provides the ability to inquire about the status of an existing authorization request. It uses ANSI X12 278 transactions and is used in conjunction with an Outgoing Referral Request for Review - Outgoing Request (X12 278R) interface.

interfaceDescription: But wait! There's more! We've also created custom integrations using the following approaches.

list.heading: Outgoing Real Time Prescription Benefit Inquiry and Response
list.description: Supports real-time prescription benefits checking (RTPB) during the prescriber ordering process. This feature lets prescribers see expected out-of-pocket costs, lower-cost medication suggestions, and whether additional approvals from the insurance company are needed before the prescription can be filled. Providers can share this information with patients before sending the order to the pharmacy, saving time and money for patients, and help improve medication adherence.   Payers/vendors who are interested in joining the RTPB network, please please  reach out for more information .

list.heading: Outgoing Newborn Personal Identity Code Request and Response
list.description: The Outgoing Newborn Personal Identity Code Request interface sends notifications of patient birth to the Population Register Centre (VRK) in Finland. The Incoming Newborn Personal Identity Code Response interface receives the response message from VRK that contains the HETU for the newborn and assigns the HETU to the patient in Epic.

list.heading: Outgoing Death Notification and Response
list.description: Sends notifications of patient death to the Population Register Centre in Finland.

list.heading: Outgoing Provider Query
list.description: This XML interface queries the Terhikki provider database to determine whether a provider has specific rights and restrictions. The rights and restrictions associated with a provider are used to determine which features in Epic the provider has access to.

list.heading: Outgoing eArchive Documents and Query
list.description: Queries the Kanta eArchive system for document metadata and content and sends new and updated documents to Kanta eArchive. Licensing for this interface includes the Outgoing eArchive Document Query interface.

list.heading: Outgoing Demographics Query
list.description: Queries the Population Register Centre (VRK) in Finland for a patient's demographics or the patient's HETU.

list.heading: Outgoing QRDA Documents
list.description: Users can create QRDA Idocuments from data in their Epic EHR. Each QRDA I document is specific to one patient and contains data pertinent to quality measure reporting. Each QRDA III document includes aggregated quality measurement data for a provider or group of providers, including the quality measures they are reporting on and their performance rate. QRDA III documents are typically used by providers for quality measure submission. Many regulatory programs, including Meaningful Use, Core Measures, Inpatient Quality Reporting, ORYX Performance Measurement Reporting, and PQRS, accept QRDA documents to satisfy their quality reporting requirements.

list.heading: Bidirectional Referrals
list.description: This pair of interfaces sends and receives referral and consultation requests, along with triage details and care summaries regarding those referrals. These messages are structured according to the HL7-Finland PikaXML standard.

list.heading: Outgoing Document Notification Interface - Finland
list.description: Sends document metadata to Navitas when Navitas queries Epic for a document ID.

list.heading: Outgoing Social Care Document Query
list.description: This XML interface queries the Kanta Social Care system for document metadata and content.

list.heading: Outgoing Dental Summary Interface - Singapore
list.description: Sends a PDF report summarizing the patient's dental health. Requires Wisdom, Epic's dental product.

list.heading: Outgoing Referral and Provider Communication Notification Interface - Singapore
list.description: Sends a notification to the National Electronic Health Record (NEHR) when referrals are entered in Epic or provider communications are written in the Communication Management activity in Epic.

list.heading: Outgoing Demographics Query Interface - Singapore
list.description: Queries the National Electronic Health Record (NEHR) system in Singapore for a patient's demographics information.

list.heading: Outgoing Transaction Notification Interface - Belgium
list.description: Sends metadata for notes, letters, results, and scans to the Belgian National Hub. This process allows the Hub to index references to the source content for external providers to request.

list.heading: Outgoing Transaction Query Interface - Belgium
list.description: Interface for Belgium. A collection of web services invoked from the Chart Review activity that retrieve a list of documents for a patient from the National Hub and request the contents of specific documentation.

list.heading: Outgoing Birth Notification and Medical Form Interface - Belgium
list.description: Sends birth notifications and birth-related medical forms to Belgium's eBirth registry according to the specifications in the eBirth Hospital Web Services Technical User Guide -  Final version - 1.6 – 12/05/2016.

list.heading: Outgoing Medication Orders Request and Response Interface - Belgium
list.description: Interface for Belgium.  Sends e-prescribing messages to, and receives acknowledgements from, Recip-e. These interfaces can be used to create new prescriptions, cancel prescriptions, and query for a list of prescriptions that a pharmacy can dispense.

list.heading: Outgoing Social Care Need Query Interface - Finland
list.description: Queries the eTotu Social Services system for patient referrals and documents.

list.heading: Outgoing Financial Transactions Query Interface - Belgium
list.description: Sends charges to and receives charge verifications from an external system. Billing-related errors logged by this interface are routed to an activity in Epic where users can correct errors and resubmit affected messages in real time.

list.heading: Outgoing Imaging Document and Response Interface - Finland
list.description: Sends reference links for R2CDA imaging documents to Navitas and receives acknowledgements in return.

list.heading: Outgoing Vaccination History Query Interface - Norway
list.description: Queries the SYSVAK vaccination registry, per  Norwegian SYSVAK specification . Each query requests historical immunization data for a given patient. This registry does not provide immunization recommendation data. The incoming portion of the interface does not directly update immunizations in the chart; the provider sees the response from the registry and decides what should be added to the patient record.

list.heading: Outgoing Vaccination Administration Request and Response Interface - Norway
list.description: Sends information about vaccination administrations,  per the  Norwegian SYSVAK specification .

list.heading: Outgoing Sick Leave Interface - Norway
list.description: Sends information regarding a patient's ability to perform work in Norway, as specified by the Norwegian Labour and Welfare administration (NAV). Relevant information includes duration of impairment, cause of impairment, and other supporting information provided by the patient's provider.

list.heading: Real-time 837 External Pricing
list.description: Epic's managed care system supports pricing claims in real-time by sending the 837 and receiving a response of a repriced 837 with HCP Segments.

list.heading: Incoming Health Care Services Authorization Interface - Netherlands
list.description: Receives notifications from VECOZO when the status of an authorization request has changed. The incoming interface can update authorization records (RFL or AUT) in Epic, which drive referral workqueue and scheduling workflows.

list.heading: Outgoing Birth Notification Interface - Norway
list.description: Sends notification of birth and receives back national identifier from the Norwegian citizen registry.

list.heading: Outgoing Vaccination Codeset Update Request and Response Interface - Norway
list.description: Queries the Norwegian SYSVAK registry and returns an import file to update the immunization build for Norwegian customers.

list.heading: Outgoing Financial Information Query Interface - Norway
list.description: Retrieves income, expense, and asset information for patients and their contacts from Financial Assistance.

list.heading: Outgoing Birth Registry Interface - Norway
list.description: Sends clinical information regarding a birth event to the MFR registry.

list.heading: Outgoing GP Patient List Subscription and Response
list.description: In Norway, a regional service (NAV) maintains a list of physicians (GPs) and the patients to whom they provide care.   This supports integration for providers to interact with NAVs service; notably, subscribing to their list (signing up for an updated list of patients to be sent monthly), ending their subscription to the monthly list, and checking the status of their subscription.

list.heading: Outgoing ePrescribing Service Request and Response Interface - Norway
list.description: ePrescribing services with the national medication directory service (SFM)

list.heading: Incoming ePrescribing Service Notification Interface - Norway
list.description: ePrescribing services with the national medication directory service.

list.heading: Incoming MDS CMS Validation Report
list.description: Takes the CMS MDS Validation Final Report flat file, parses the result of all of the MDS assessments in the report, and files the results of the validation back to MDS records in Epic stored in the RDI Masterfile. The MDS Validation Final Report flat file is generated by CMS QIES and the specification for the report can be found in the CASPER Reporting User's Guide For MDS Providers. A full list of CMS error and warning codes (edits) can be found in section 5 of the MDS 3.0 Provider User's Guide.

list.heading: Outgoing Vaccination Administration Request and Response - Australia
list.description: Sends information about vaccination administrations to the Australian Immunisation Register (AIR).  In an upcoming version, will also query AIR for immunization history.

list.heading: Incoming Provider Communications Interface - Finland
list.description: Receives incoming summary of care if patient receives care out of home municipality.

list.heading: Outgoing Provider Communications - Finland
list.description: Sends outgoing communication and summary of care for patients receiving care outside of home municipality.

list.heading: Tapestry Incoming Bank Reconciliation
list.description: Receives status updates for check records to match the status assigned by the bank responsible for distributing the check.

list.heading: Tapestry Incoming Benefit Accumulations
list.description: Receives external benefit bucket information so that member cost responsibility can be calculated correctly when processing claims.

list.heading: Tapestry Outgoing Positive Pay Files
list.description: Sends check information for processed claims to banks as part of the claims payment cycle.

list.heading: Incoming Drug Supply Chain Event Notification to Willow Inventory
list.description: Enables supply chain partners to capture event information about supply chain events and to share that information with their trading partners securely.  Uses the Electronic Product Code Information Service (EPCIS) GS1 standard and complies with the Drug Supply Change Security Act (DSCSA) regulation that requires organizations exchange package-level tracing information.

list.heading: Outgoing Dialysis Updates to CMS
list.description: Sends Dialysis Data to CMS (by way of a Renal Healthcare HIE) from the Dialysis Module, per HIE specifications.  Requires Nephrology license.  Specifications are found   https://qnetconfluence.cms.gov/display/ELDF/Documentation+Repository

list.heading: Incoming Scheduling Slot Availability Query
list.description: Receives requests from the United Kingdom's NHS e-Referral Service (also known as Choose and Book) to request appointment slots from Cadence, Epic's scheduling system.

list.heading: Outgoing PDS Tracing Query
list.description: Outgoing PDS Tracing interface sends queries to the Personal Demographics Services (PDS) master index for National Health Service (NHS) patient records in the United Kingdom. PDS Trace Response messages are processed by the Incoming PDS Tracing interface. Message interactions follow HSCIC's Message Implementation Manual (MIM) version 7.2.02 and External Interface Specification 11.6. This interface uses messages expressed in XML encoding syntax.

list.heading: Outgoing PDS Demographics Synchronisation Query
list.description: Outgoing PDS Synchronisation interface sends queries for demographics and demographic updates to the Personal Demographics Services (PDS) master index for National Health Service (NHS) patient records in the United Kingdom. PDS Synchronisation Response messages are processed by the Incoming PDS Synchronisation interface. Message interactions follow HSCIC's Message Implementation Manual (MIM) version 7.2.02 and External Interface Specification 11.6. This interface uses messages expressed in XML encoding syntax.

list.heading: Outgoing PDS Number Allocation Request for Acute Care
list.description: Sends requests to the Personal Demographics Services (PDS) to generate a new National Health Service (NHS) number for an adult patient in an acute care setting in the United Kingdom. PDS NHS Number Response messages are processed by the Incoming PDS NHS Number Allocation interface. Message interactions follow HSCIC's Message Implementation Manual (MIM) version 6.3.01 and External Interface Specification 11.6. This interface uses messages expressed in XML encoding syntax.

list.heading: Outgoing PDS Newborn Notification
list.description: Sends requests to the Personal Demographics Services (PDS) to generate a new National Health Service (NHS) number for a newborn delivery documented in Stork within the United Kingdom. PDS Create Initial Record Response messages are processed by the Incoming PDS Create Initial Record Response interface. Message interactions follow HSCIC's Message Implementation Manual (MIM) version 7.2.02 and External Interface Specification 11.6. This interface uses messages expressed in XML encoding syntax.

list.heading: Outgoing Medication Orders
list.description: Sends outgoing e-prescribed medication orders, following Dutch HL7 v3 Standards

list.heading: Outgoing Medication Dispense History Query
list.description: Queries the Landelijk SchakelPunt (LSP) to retrieve patient medication data. Certified with VZVZ. This interface follows the Dutch HL7 v3 standards implemented within AORTA.

list.heading: Outgoing Medication Orders
list.description: Sends ambulatory medication orders that are placed in Order Entry to the National Electronic Health Record (NEHR) in the format required by the NEHR putOrderedMedications service. This interface uses the XML message format.

list.heading: Outgoing Medication Dispenses
list.description: Sends outpatient medication dispenses to the National Electronic Health Record (NEHR) in the format required by the NEHR putDispensedMedications service. Messages are sent whenever an outpatient medication dispense is received from an internal pharmacy system through an Incoming Medication Orders to EpicCare Ambulatory interface. This interface uses the XML message format.

list.heading: Outgoing Laboratory Results
list.description: Sends laboratory results to the National Electronic Health Record (NEHR) in the format required by the NEHR putLabResults service. This interface uses the XML message format.

list.heading: Outgoing Radiology Results
list.description: Sends radiology results to the National Electronic Health Record (NEHR) in the format required by the NEHR putRadiologyResults service. This interface uses the XML message format.

list.heading: Outgoing Discharge Summaries
list.description: Sends a clinical summary to the National Electronic Health Record (NEHR) in the format required by the NEHR putDischargeSummary service. The summary is generated upon discharge of a patient.

list.heading: Outgoing ED Summaries
list.description: Sends a clinical summary to the National Electronic Health Record (NEHR) in the format required by the NEHR putEDNotes service. The summary is generated when the patient is discharged or dismissed from the emergency department.

list.heading: Outgoing Surgical Summaries
list.description: Sends a surgical summary to the National Electronic Health Record (NEHR) in the format required by the NEHR putOTNotes service at the time that a surgical log is posted or addended. This interface uses the XML message format.

list.heading: Outgoing Health Care Claim Code Editor
list.description: Bidirectional claim code editing interface that can work with various external systems.

list.heading: Outgoing Health Care Claim Grouper and Pricer
list.description: Bidirectional interface that analyzes claims to determine which codes and prices are appropriate, and can work with various external systems.

list.heading: Outgoing Municipality Integrations
list.description: Manages communication with external municipal systems according to established MedCom protocols to coordinate the delivery of home care after discharge. The outgoing interface supports: automatic admission and discharge notifications to alert municipalities when their citizens have been admitted to and discharged from the hospital, clinical reports by nursing staff to convey updated clinical information and home care needs to the home care system so they can prepare to assume responsibility for the patient, and administrative notifications to coordinate and document the extension of admissions if the municipality is not yet prepared to accept responsibility for patient care. This integration also includes an incoming interface for filing admission reports sent by municipality home care systems when they receive an admission notification from the hospital. Clinical staff can use these admission reports to review the current status of home care patients. This interface uses the Medcom XML/EDIFACT standard.

list.heading: Bidirectional Correspondence
list.description: Sends and receives patient-centric clinical correspondence messages to external parties, including other hospitals, general practitioners, and municipal systems. These messages are used for ad hoc communication to convey additional information beyond what is included in other specifications.

list.heading: Outgoing Newborn CPR Assignment Request and Response
list.description: Registers newborns in the Danish civil registration system (CPR) and reserves a corresponding CPR identifier (national ID). This interface uses the Medcom Web Service standard.

list.heading: Outgoing Order Requisitions
list.description: Sends orders placed by a clinical user to either an external LIS or Danish laboratory outside the organization. This interface supports general chemistry, blood bank, microbiology, and pathology laboratory procedures placed by users in EpicCare Inpatient and EpicCare Ambulatory, and pathology procedures placed by clinical users in OpTime. This interface uses the Medcom XML standard.

list.heading: Incoming Pathology Results
list.description: Receives pathology test results from a LIS for use in Epic. Results can be received for orders placed in Epic or placed elsewhere. Additionally, this interface can update the status of the results to In Process, Preliminary, Final, or Final-Edited. This interface uses the Medcom XML standard.

list.heading: Incoming Lab Results Interface
list.description: Receives general chemistry, blood bank, and microbiology test results from LIS for use in Epic. Results can be received for orders placed in Epic or placed elsewhere. Additionally, this interface can update the status of the result to In Process, Preliminary, Final, or Final- Edited. This interface uses the Medcom XML standard.

list.heading: Outgoing Referrals and Booking Confirmation
list.description: Manages outgoing referrals communication with external systems according to established MedCom protocols. The interface facilitates sending new referrals composed in Epic and forwarding copies of previously received referral messages. The interface can also send booking confirmations to inform a patient's referring and primary care physicians when a referral is being acted on in Epic. These notifications can be sent automatically when an appointment has been scheduled, or when a patient is preadmitted or arrived in the ED for an issue relating to the referral. This interface uses the Medcom XML/EDIFACT standard.

list.heading: Incoming Referrals and Booking Confirmation
list.description: Manages incoming referrals communications with external systems according to established MedCom protocols. This interface can both create incoming hospital referrals and file booking confirmation messages for referrals originating in Epic.

list.heading: Outgoing Binary Documents
list.description: Sends binary attachment documents associated with a MedCom message. This interface must work in conjunction with one of the following MedCom interfaces: Outgoing Summary of Care, Outgoing Referrals and Booking Confirmation, Bidirectional Correspondence, and Outgoing Order Requisitions.

list.heading: Incoming Binary Documents
list.description: Files the binary attachment documents associated with an incoming MedCom message to the Epic WebBLOB server. This interface must work in conjunction with one of the following MedCom interfaces: Incoming Summary of Care, Incoming Referrals and Booking Confirmation, Bidirectional Correspondence, Outgoing Municipality Integrations - Incoming Response, Incoming Rehabilitation Plan Summary, Incoming Lab Results, and Incoming Pathology Results.

list.heading: Outgoing Procedure Log Data
list.description: Sends data for configured case tracking events from a Cupid procedure log case for the purpose of submitting data to external registries. Submissions to the NCDR CathPCI & NCDR ICD registries can be sent directly from Cupid, Epic's CVIS. The messages contain data on the case including panels, staff, timeouts, implants, equipment, radiation, verifications, flowsheets, events, medications, and labs.

list.heading: Incoming Referral Scheduling Request Query
list.description: Receives requests from the United Kingdom's NHS e-Referral Service (also known as Choose and Book) to book an appointment in Cadence, Epic's scheduling system.

list.heading: Incoming Summary of Care Interface
list.description: Files a summary of care document (Epikrise) from an external hospital or specialist as a note to the patient's chart. These notes describe the care that the patient received from the external hospital or specialist and can be used as reference when providing care in Epic.

list.heading: Outgoing Summary of Care Interface
list.description: Sends a summary of care document (Epikrise) to the patient's referring provider and primary care physician to report the outcome of an ED visit, admission, or ambulatory encounter using a combination of discrete and free-text information. Summary of care messages are automatically sent for the patient whenever a designated Epikrise note has been signed and the patient's encounter is closed. This interface uses the Medcom XML/EDIFACT standard.

list.heading: Outgoing PAS Data and Response Interface
list.description: Sends patient, referral, administrative pathway, and encounter data grouped by patient episode to the Victorian Integrated Non-Admitted Health (VINAH) database, which is run by the State of Victoria Department of Health & Human Services in Australia. Additionally, this interface receives asynchronous acknowledgments and error information from VINAH. This interface uses messages expressed in XML encoding syntax.

list.heading: Data Exchange with 3M Core Grouping Software
list.description: This is a proprietary specification to/from 3M's Core Grouping Software. Medicare OP claims data is sent to the 3M CGS Module. CSG performs APC/APG grouping, reimbursement calculations, OCE and proprietary clams scrubbing; the results are loaded back into Epic where errors can drive claim edits.

list.heading: Outgoing FMK Medication Card Services Request and Response
list.description: Manages the following interactions between Epic and the Danish medication database Falles Medicinkort (FMK): Filing medication lists for patients into Epic; pushing medication changes from Epic to the national database; and setting the reviewed status of the medication list by a clinician.

list.heading: Outgoing Medication Orders to Prescription Exchange Service
list.description: Sends medication orders and receives acknowledgements from a prescription exchange service (the currently supported service is eRx). When clinicians create, cancel, or amend medication orders, this XML interface relays the ePrescription information to eRx, which forwards the medication information to the appropriate dispensing facility. This interface uses the XML message format.

list.heading: Outgoing Birth Notification Interface
list.description: Sends a report to register newborns in the municipal child care system and begin coordination of home visits by municipal pediatric nursing after discharge.

list.heading: Outgoing ECPR Assignment Request and Response
list.description: Requests ECPR identifiers for request a new official ECPR from the Denmark national ECPR registry for non-Danish residents, anonymous, trauma, and unknown patients.

list.heading: Outgoing Rehabilitation Plan Summary
list.description: Sends a summary of the physical therapy/rehabilitation (GGOP) provided for a patient and needs for ongoing therapy/rehab. Frequently used as a way for physical therapists to document ongoing care for a patient, provide progress updates to external parties such as their primary care physician, and transition responsibility for therapy to other entities such as other hospitals or municipality rehabilitation systems. This interface uses the XML (DGOP), GGOP (MedCom XML) standard.

list.heading: Incoming Rehabilitation Plan Summary
list.description: Receives incoming summaries of physical therapy/rehabilitation (GGOP) from physical therapists. This interface can be configured to create scheduling orders, which users can use to plan future appointments for the patient's care. This interface uses the XML (DGOP) GGOP (MedCom XML) standard.

list.heading: Outgoing Prescription Prior Authorization Request and Response
list.description: Submits prior authorization requests to the DHPO and HAAD post office. This interface uses the HAAD XML standard.

list.heading: Outgoing Claim Submission from Willow Ambulatory
list.description: Submits claims to the DHPO and HAAD post office. This interface uses the HAAD XML standard.

list.heading: Incoming Remittance Advice Download to Willow Ambulatory
list.description: Downloads remittance advices that are stored in HAAD post office using a batch job. This interface uses the HAAD XML standard.

list.heading: Outgoing COV Verification Query
list.description: The interface queries Vecozo and uses the VZ37/VZ38 standard to retrieve and store insurance information for a patient. This interface uses the VZ37 / VZ38 standard.

list.heading: Outgoing IHI Verification Query
list.description: Queries the Australian Healthcare Identifiers (HI) Service to retrieve and validate a patient's Individual Healthcare Identifier (IHI) Number. The main goal of this query is to allow modules such as Care Everywhere to interact with My Health Record, which requires valid IHI Numbers for patients when uploading documents.

list.heading: Outgoing Perinatal Data
list.description: Submits summary reports at the end of each pregnancy to Perined, a national registry in the Netherlands that records obstetric data. This interface uses the XML HL7 NL standard.

list.heading: Outgoing Initial Public Health Case Report
list.description: Satisfies the Meaningful Use objective to send Electronic Case Reports to public health agencies using the HL7 Clinical Document - Electronic Initial Case Report (CDA-eICR) format.

list.heading: Outgoing FMK Ordered Refill Request and Response
list.description: Sends refill requests to the Danish medication database Fælles Medicinkort (FMK) for a patient or an entire facility.

list.heading: Outgoing eRx Services Request and Response
list.description: Communicates with the prescription center of Finland any time a user makes changes to a patient's prescriptions, as well as when a user needs to reconcile a patient's existing prescriptions into Epic.

list.heading: Outgoing Prescription Upload Request and Response
list.description: Submits a prescription to the UAE Post Office hub for authorization.

list.heading: Outgoing Prescription Download Request and Response
list.description: Downloads a patient's prescriptions from the UAE Post Office hub.

list.heading: Mobile App Integration
list.description: Epic's mobile applications - Haiku, Canto, and Rover - can communicate with specialized clinical review applications like document or image viewers.  This framework allows our applications to launch your app with context, making for a a smooth and seamless clinical experience for the user.

list.heading: Clinical Context Manager Integration
list.description: CCOW (formerly known as Clinical Context Object Workgroup) is a vendor-independent HL7 standard protocol designed to allow disparate clinical applications to synchronize data in real-time at the point of care. Epic can integrate as a participant with a third-party clinical context manager.

list.heading: Patient Portal Links
list.description: Epic's patient portal can link to other patient-specific websites through functionality known as Dynamic Links. Dynamic Links are used to launch external websites from within the portal. The link can be configured to pass context about the patient through query string parameters, optionally encrypted using AES.

list.heading: Cash Management
list.description: This incoming batch interface creates a record of deposits for cash reconciliation using a configurable flat file format. The flat file is configurable and the preferred format is in the linked specification, however Epic can also support industry standard formats such as CCD+.

list.heading: Incoming Claim Status Batch (Flat File)
list.description: This incoming batch interface loads information about claim status through a configurable flat file. This interface can update the status of claims in the system and is able to load claim error information from payer and intermediary systems. The flat file format is configurable, but the common specification is pre-configured in the Foundation System for Epic customers and widely used with success.

list.heading: Incoming Self-pay Payments
list.description: This incoming batch interface posts self-pay and bad debt payments in a configurable flat file format. The flat file format is configurable, but the above common specification is pre-configured in the Foundation System for Epic customers and widely used with success.

list.heading: Monthly Premium Withholding Report (MPWR)
list.description: Transmits premium information to Medicare Advantage plans.

list.heading: Outgoing 1095-B (Simple)
list.description: The 1095-B is a flat file for tax information.

list.heading: Outgoing 1099-MISC
list.description: The 1099-MISC tax form is used to report miscellaneous income for Vendors from an AP Cycle processing.

list.heading: Batch Eligibility Query (BEQ)
list.description: Outbound BEQ request and Incoming BEQ response. BEQ is a way for plans to submit batches of individuals for verification of various eligibilities.

list.heading: Outbound Medicare Advantage and Prescription Drug System (MARx) files
list.description: File for reporting drug information between a health plan and CMS.

list.heading: Tapestry Document Linker DMS Integration
list.description: We recommend using  the Hyperdrive Document Linker  instead of this technology. This VB integration enables users in an external document management system to launch the Tapestry Document Linker activity in an active Hyperspace session and pass necessary document information to link a document to records in Epic. Additionally the integration can allow for users in the DMS to create new claim and CRM records in Hyperspace with links to the desired document.

list.heading: Collections Extract and Import
list.description: Epic can generate a flat file extract to collections agencies containing information about charges assigned to the agency. Epic can also receive flat file imports with updates to those charges to support tracking of payments and changes to charges in Resolute.

list.heading: SAML 2.0 Idp-initiated Single Sign-On (SSO)
list.description: Epic supports launching an external app with SAML 2.0. The SAML 2.0 Identity Provider initiated workflow initiates from Epic, playing the SAML role of Identity Provider. Implementation requires the exchange of an x509 certificate, which is used to sign the SAML claims. This process follows the OASIS SAML 2.0 specification. Epic recommends the use of  SMART on FHIR  over SAML if possible.

list.heading: Single Sign-On (SSO) into MyChart
list.description: Typically, the patient portal manages all aspects of patient and user identity. However, a single-sign on integrator could be used to link together the Epic patient portal with other portal-based functionality already in use. In this scenario, usernames and passwords are managed by an external system. The patient logs into the external system, which then can be used to also sign the patient into MyChart. A bundle of Web services are used to create and update patient records and to create and manage proxy relationships. We'll provide you with the specs for this interface at the time we've identified a mutual customer.

list.heading: Single Sign-On (SSO) into EpicCare Link
list.description: Other systems can provide SSO integration into Epic applications like EpicWeb, EpicCare Link, Tapestry Link, or OutReach by passing user and optionally patient context.

list.heading: Appointment Notifications
list.description: Interactive Voice Response systems can be used to deliver appointment reminders to patients prior to their visits, asking them to confirm. Once the appointment is confirmed, the IVR system sends this information back to the Epic EHR so clinic staff can estimate no-show probabilities.

list.heading: Recall Notifications
list.description: Interactive Voice Response systems can be used to remind patients to schedule appointments for upcoming recalls. Once the communication happens, the IVR system sends this information back to the Epic EHR to finish the documentation.

list.heading: Request Notifications
list.description: Interactive Voice Response systems can be used to remind patients to schedule appointments for upcoming appointment requests. Once the communication happens, the IVR system sends this information back to the Epic EHR to finish the documentation.

list.heading: Incoming Rehabilitation Plan Summary
list.description: Receives incoming summaries of physical therapy/rehabilitation (GGOP) from physical therapists. This interface can be configured to create scheduling orders, which users can use to plan future appointments for the patient's care. This interface uses the XML (DGOP) GGOP (MedCom XML) standard.

list.heading: Incoming Receipts
list.description: Receives receipts for messages sent to the VANS network in relation to the Medcom message sent.

list.heading: Outgoing Receipts
list.description: Sends positive or negative receipt messages for Medcom messages received from the VANS network using the Medcom XML/EDIFACT standard.

list.heading: eMediplan APIs
list.description: These APIs enable queries into Epic for the full medication list for a patient and can generate a push notification when a user requests an eMediplan in Epic. An interface engine can use the notification to call into these APIs and standard FHIR APIs to gather the necessary information to request an eMediplan document from the HCI eMediplan system. This document can be filed into Epic with an  Incoming Scanned Document Link interface  or shared with other healthcare organizations. The document includes a QR code that healthcare providers can use to retrieve the patient's medications from eMediplan.

list.heading: Incoming External Clinical Data
list.description: As organizations extend Epic to affiliated practices in their communities, there has been an increasing need to convert historical patient-level data from other vendors' systems into Epic. This interface allows organizations to load patient-level data from organizations that do not otherwise support standards-based data exchange.

list.heading: Paid Claims Import
list.description: Paid claim data can be imported into Epic to support population health and care management workflows by reconciling the data with the rest of the comprehensive medical record. This format is recommended when the data is can be manipulated or the extract is flexible to simplify the process of importing into Epic.

list.heading: EDManager
list.description: This set of APIs allow external applications that are running alongside Epic Hyperspace to programmatically take certain actions, such as logging in/out and launching activities. They also provide the ability to query Epic Hyperspace for information, as well as to be notified when key events occur. These APIs are commonly used for automating external-driven workflows, most notably logins.

list.heading: Desktop Generic Authentication
list.description: This interface allows external authentication software to implement authentication devices for use in Epic. The external authentication software can write installable devices that can be configured for use as devices to authenticate a user for login into Epic, to re-authenticate the user after login (for example, to sign off on medications), or to identify a patient (for example, to check into an appointment).

list.heading: Scan Acquisition
list.description: This COM integration enables users to seamlessly launch an external scan acquisition interface from Epic. Epic can pass the user's active context information, such as the patient, encounter, or order.

list.heading: Scan Viewing
list.description: This COM integration enables Epic to display an ActiveX scan viewing control in a modeless floating window. The user can interact with both the viewer and Epic, and Epic will manage closing the window if the user's patient context changes.

list.heading: EPS Document Retrieval Plugin
list.description: This .NET integration enables Epic print services (EPS) to query a document management system (DMS) for images or documents to insert into a print job. This is useful when you want a scan to be stored in your DMS, but want to include that scan in something you print. We recommend new implementations use the  EPS Document Retrieval Web Service  instead of this.

list.heading: SIEM Feed
list.description: Epic can feed certain security and privacy relevant events to a security information and event management (SIEM) system in near real-time.  Messages coming from Epic can be formatted using Common Event Framework (CEF), Log Event Extended Format (LEEF), or RFC 5424 syslog.

list.heading: Epic Access Logging
list.description: The Epic Access Logging extract script extracts key Epic event logging data, including patient, user, and encounter information, from the Epic organization’s Clarity database into a pipe delimited flat file.

list.heading: Speech Recognition
list.description: This set of APIs allow speech recognition systems to integrate with Epic Hyperspace.  The speech recognition system can receive information about and make changes to the content of a control. See also our  Hyperdrive Speech Recognition  specifications.

list.heading: Computable Exports
list.description: Epic software gives users the ability to export electronic health information in multiple formats depending on the use case. The following computable formats are available: FHIR-formatted files  for a subset of electronic health information in FHIR. C-CDA-formatted XML documents  for the subsets of electronic health information that can be expressed in C-CDA templates. EHI Tables for complete electronic health information, in a tab-separated value (TSV) file format native to Epic. Refer to  the EHI Tables technical specification  for detailed information about what’s included in this export by default. A copy of the specification might also be included in the Full EHI Export package you receive. The TSV files might also come packaged with non-computable files that are referenced in a patient record, such as media files and rich text format notes.

list.heading: Welcome Accessibility for Vendors
list.description: Welcome is Epic’s application for patient self-service arrivals using kiosk enclosures or free-roaming tablets. This guide is intended for vendors supplying Welcome hardware and software solutions and provides an overview of some considerations associated with supporting an accessible patient workflow on those form factors

list.heading: Welcome Hardware Guide For Vendors
list.description: Welcome is Epic’s application for patient self-service arrivals using kiosk enclosures or free-roaming tablets. This guide is intended for vendors supplying Welcome hardware solutions and provides an in-depth guide to the integration considerations soliciting organizations may have when requesting hardware.

list.heading: PB Statement Form 807
list.description: Epic can generate a delimited plain text file of information that can be shared with a statement vendor. This file includes information about the patient and their Professional Billing balances in Epic. File format subject to change - fields and segments may be added or removed with future development. Programming should accept or ignore additional fields and segments when they occur gracefully.
